article_title: Taking New Hampshire vacation just to meet candidates
article_text:
Total Access

Enjoy the convenience of home delivery plus Digital D. Sign up for our BEST VALUE today!

article_metadata.description: CLAREMONT, N.H. — Brewster Rhoads readily admits the road trip was “a bit of a lark.” The newly minted Cincinnati retiree and his wife, lawyer Ann Lugbill, had a week free in early December, so they decided to spend it in New Hampshire. To hear a bunch of politicians give speeches. Yes, on purpose.
